org.gm4java.im4java

Class GMOperation

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.im4java.core.Operation
      • org.im4java.core.GMOps
        • org.im4java.core.GMOperation
          • org.gm4java.im4java.GMOperation

  • public class GMOperation
extends org.im4java.core.GMOperation
    This class wraps the GM command in interactive or batch mode.

    Note: Does not support asynchronous mode; Does not support BufferedImage

    Author:
    Michael Magpayo

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  GMOperation.GeometryAnnotation
      Options which modify the behavior of the 'width X height' specification for geometry-based settings.
      static class  GMOperation.Gravity
      Used in conjunction with other settings, generally defines how to interpret the offset for geometry-based options.
      static class  GMOperation.RotationAnnotation
      Options which modify the behavior of the 'degrees' specification for rotation-based settings.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GMOperation

        public GMOperation()

    • Method Detail

      • limitThreads

        public GMOperation limitThreads(int threadsPerProcess)
        Limits the number of threads used by the GraphicsMagick process during execution. Note that no validation is made, so ensure that the value is a non-positive integer presumably less than the maximum CPU cores on the host.
        Parameters:
        threadsPerProcess - Number of threads to use per process.
        Returns:
        Builder object for chained options setup.

      • resize

        public GMOperation resize(int width,
                 int height,
                 Collection<GMOperation.GeometryAnnotation> annotations)
        Resize source to desired target dimensions, using default resizing filter algorithm.
        Parameters:
        width - Length in pixels of the target image's width.
        height - Length in pixels of the target image's height.
        annotations - Geometry annotations to define how the width and height options are to be interpreted.
        Returns:
        Builder object for chained options setup.

      • scale

        public GMOperation scale(int width,
                int height,
                Collection<GMOperation.GeometryAnnotation> annotations)
        Scale source to desired target dimensions, using simplified resizing algorithm with pixel averaging.
        Parameters:
        width - Length in pixels of the target image's width.
        height - Length in pixels of the target image's height.
        annotations - Geometry annotations to define how the width and height options are to be interpreted.
        Returns:
        Builder object for chained options setup.

      • rotate

        public GMOperation rotate(double degrees,
                 GMOperation.RotationAnnotation annotation)
        Rotates the image, with empty triangles back-filled using default background color.
        Parameters:
        degrees - The angle by which the image should be rotated. Positive numbers indicate clockwise direction; negative numbers indicate counterclockwise direction.
        annotation - Rotate annotation to define when rotation should happen.
        Returns:
        Builder object for chained options setup.

      • gravity

        public GMOperation gravity(GMOperation.Gravity value)
        Defines the gravity for geometry-based operations. See documentation for more details, as this option works in conjunction with various options in different ways.
        Parameters:
        value - Gravity value to use, defining the coordinate system to use.
        Returns:
        Builder object for chained options setup.

      • grayscale

        public GMOperation grayscale(int depth)
        Convert the image to grayscale (i.e. replace color encoding with smaller gray encoding).
        Parameters:
        depth - the depth of the grayscale
        Returns:
        Builder object for chained options setup.

      • stripProfiles

        public GMOperation stripProfiles()
        Strips out ICC profiles.
        Returns:
        Builder object for chained options setup.

      • font

        public GMOperation font(String style,
               int size,
               String color)
        Defines font for text overlay.
        Parameters:
        style - Text font style (system-dependent based on installed fonts).
        size - Text point size.
        color - Text color, either named or #RGB variant.
        Returns:
        Builder object for chained options setup.

      • drawText

        public GMOperation drawText(String text,
                   int offsetX,
                   int offsetY)
        Draws text overlay on image with the upper-right corner defined by the offsetX and offsetY parameters. Note that will affect how the offset values are interpreted.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to write.
        offsetX - Offset value in the horizontal direction.
        offsetY - Offset value in the vertical direction.
        Returns:
        Builder object for chained options setup.

      • source

        public GMOperation source(File file,
                 @CheckForNull
                 Integer width,
                 @CheckForNull
                 Integer height)
                   throws IOException
        Specifies the source image to convert.
        Parameters:
        file - Source image file to convert.
        width - Length in pixels of the source image's width; if null or negative, the in-memory size definition is omitted. Optional.
        height - Length in pixels of the source image's height; if null or negative, the in-memory size definition is omitted. Optional.
        Returns:
        Builder object for chained options setup.
        Throws:
        IOException - when the source file does not exist.

      • addImage

        public GMOperation addImage(File file)
        Add image to operation.
        Parameters:
        file - image file to be added.
        Returns:
        Builder object for chained options setup.

      • addRawArg

        public GMOperation addRawArg(String arg)
        Add raw text to the list of arguments.
        Parameters:
        arg - argument to add
        Returns:
        Builder object for chained options setup.

      • quality

        public GMOperation quality(double quality)
        Add option -quality to the GraphicsMagick commandline (see the documentation of GraphicsMagick for details).
        Parameters:
        quality - the quality of the image from 0 - 100
        Returns:
        Builder object for chained options setup
